description: Triangle of numbers a(n,k) = number of balance positions when k equal weights are placed at a k-subset of the points {-n, -(n-1), ..., n-1, n} on a centrally pivoted rod.
references: R. E. Odeh and E. J. Cockayne, Balancing weights on the integer line, J. Combin. Theory, 7 (1969), 130-135.
formula: Equivalent to number of partitions of n(2k-n+1)/2 into up to n parts each no more than 2k-n+1 so a(n, k)=A067059(n, n(2k-n+1)/2); row sums are A047653(n)-1 = A212352(n). - _Henry Bottomley_, Aug 11 2001
